intro: Kurrimia gracilis, commonly known as the slender kurrimia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves make it an attractive addition to gardens. Kurrimia gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
